subject: Physical Fitness
title: Lactic Acid Doesn't Cause Soreness
description: A short lesson to help you apply Lactic Acid Doesn't Cause Soreness.

hook.text: The day after a hard workout, your muscles ache. Everyone blames lactic acid. Everyone is wrong.

buildup.text: Lactate clears from muscles within an hour of exercise. Soreness peaks 24‚Äì48 hours later.

discovery.text: Delayed-onset muscle soreness (DOMS) comes from micro-tears in muscle fibers and the inflammatory repair.

twist.text: Lactate is actually fuel, not waste. Your heart and brain happily burn it for energy during exercise.

climax.text: The myth persists because lactate correlates with hard effort. But correlation isn't causation.

punchline.text: Lactate fuels you. Micro-tears make you sore. Different things entirely.
